VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Create a Kit

Combine two or more existing standard product SKUs into a single purchasable item. A kit's price is always the sum of the component products' price list items. By default, a kit can't include an exclusive item that isn’t available outside of the kit.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create CC Product records:	Create on CC Products
To create CC Product Media records:	Create on CC Product Media
To add a product to a price list	Create on CC Price List Items

A kit has a unique Product Detail page with a unique SKU, short description, product media, and other content. The kit's Product Detail page also lists all the component products.

Create two or more component products that you want to include in the kit.
Select Product from the component product's Product Type picklist.
NOTE B2B Commerce for Visualforce doesn't support nesting composite products. Each component product in the composite product must be a standard product type, and not another composite product.
Enter a unique SKU and short description for the component product.
If you’re using B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) or later, optionally select Exclude from Product Index.
NOTE When you select this option, the product isn’t included in the product index build job. As a result, the product isn't shown in search results or category results on the Product List page. The product still has a Product Detail page, and you can link to the product from a promotion or a Related Products page section.

For a composite product, maybe you want to keep the composite product available in search results, but exclude some or all of its component products. Select Exclude from Product Index on the component product records, but leave this option deselected on the composite product record.

Add unique product images for the component product.
Create a price list item and specify a price for the component product on a price list. Make sure to add all component products to the same price list.
For each component product, enter a shipping weight.
NOTE B2B Commerce for Visualforce uses the component product's shipping weight to calculate shipping costs during checkout.
Create a composite product record for the kit.
On the CC Products tab, create a product record.
From Product Type, select Kit.
Enter a unique SKU and short description for the kit.
In the Shipping section, optionally enter shipping information for the kit.
NOTE The kit's shipping information is for display only, and isn't used to calculate shipping costs. To show the kit's shipping information on the Product Detail page, create a page section.
On the kit product's Product Media related list, add unique images for the kit. For example, add an image that shows all component products being used together.
Create a price list item for the kit product. Because B2B Commerce for Visualforce automatically calculates the kit price based on the component product price list items, enter 0 for the kit's price.
Assign the component products to the kit.
On the kit product record, scroll to the Composite Products related list, and click New.
In Component, search for a component product to add.
In Quantity, enter the component product quantity to include in the kit.
NOTE If Quantity is empty for a component product, the composite product's Product Detail page doesn't show the Add to Cart button.
Enter a Sequence value.
NOTE To determine the order of component products shown on a composite product's Product Detail page, B2B Commerce for Visualforce compares the Sequence values of all components. Lower Sequence values display first.
Save your changes, or click Save & New to add another component product.
If you're done updating product records, refresh product index records by running the product index batch jobs.
WARNING If you have more product records to update, wait to refresh product index records. Depending on the size and complexity of your product data, the batch jobs that build product index records can take a long time to complete.

When a buyer adds a kit to the shopping cart, the kit appears as a line item in the cart. To see the list of included component products, the buyer can click the Included Items link on the kit.
